children.value: plugin designed for the programmatic submission of metadata and raw sequence reads to the European Nucleotide Archive (ENA).
To develop this plugin, we followed the
. The submission process is depicted in the image above (courtesy of the ENA).
plugin can be installed into any QIIME 2 conda environment (see

for
more specific installation instructions). To install the plugin, run the following commands:
Refresh the QIIME 2 cache and check if the plugin is available:
Alternatively, you can also create a dedicated environment by executing:
The ena-uploader offers several actions for adding, deleting, and modifying your submission. See the list below for details:
Upload sample and/or study metadata to ENA.
Upload raw read files to the ENA FTP server.
Submit metadata and raw reads to ENA.
For a more detailed description of each action, refer to the sections below.
and obtain credentials - this should be done 24h before the actual submission.
Upload sample and study metadata to ENA.
Transfer raw reads to the ENA FTP server.
Steps 2-4 should be performed in the specified order. Alternatively, the

action can be used to
submit metadata and raw reads in a single step. To jump to the section on simplified submission, click
To import the metadata of a study into the corresponding QIIME artifacts, run:

qiime tools import \
  --type ENAMetadataStudy \
  --input-path study_metadata.tsv \
  --output-path study_metadata.qza

[!TIP]
To create a valid study TSV file, two mandatory parameters are required:
For fields such as URL links, both the description and the link should be combined into a single field in the TSV file, separated by a

symbol.
The name of the filed should start with the
When constructing a valid study metadata TSV file, consider consulting one of the provided examples:
To import the sample metadata into the corresponding QIIME artifacts, run:

qiime tools import \
  --type ENAMetadataSamples \
  --input-path sample_metadata.tsv \
  --output-path sample_metadata.qza

[!TIP]
For sample submission, ENA provides metadata checklists detailing the minimal attributes required for different sample types.
Please review the full range of checklists

[!NOTE]
When using the default checklist for all your samples, you don’t need to specify the default code

.
However, if you apply multiple checklists for different samples, you must include all relevant codes in the metadata column checklist.

[!IMPORTANT]
Minimal sample structure refers to the default data checklist. To create a valid TSV file, four mandatory parameters are needed for each sample:
When constructing a valid study metadata TSV file, consider consulting one of the provided examples:
To import the experiment metadata into the corresponding QIIME artifacts, run:

qiime tools import \
  --type ENAMetadataExperiment \
  --input-path experiment_metadata.tsv \
  --output-path experiment_metadata.qza

[!IMPORTANT]
For experiment submission, ENA supports controlled vocabulary in the metadata fields, which can be accessed

[!IMPORTANT]
The minimal experiment structure requires the following mandatory fields:
(study alias or accession number - should correspond to the alias indicated in the study metadata)
When constructing a valid experiment metadata TSV file, consider consulting one of the provided examples:
Before uploading to ENA, you need to set two environmental variables containing your ENA credentials:

[!WARNING]
Please ensure that your credentials are set at least 24 hours before your first submission to the ENA server.
Execute the following QIIME 2 action to submit study and sample metadata to perform a test submission to the ENA

qiime ena-uploader submit-metadata-samples \
  --i-study study_metadata.qza \
  --i-samples sample_metadata.qza \
  --p-action ADD \
  --p-dev \
  --p-submission-hold-date <hold date> \
  --o-submission-receipt samples_receipt.qza
: Artifact containing metadata of the study.
: Artifact containing metadata of the samples.
: 2 action types are supported: ADD (default) and MODIFY.
: A boolean parameter indicating whether the submission is a test.

: The release date of the study, on which it will become public along with all submitted data. By default, this date is set to two months after the date of submission. Users can specify any date within two years of the current date. Accepted date format is
: The output artifact containing the assigned ENA accession numbers for the submitted objects.

[!NOTE]
You can submit a study and metadata either separately or together; only one of the corresponding artifacts is required for submission. However, please note that to submit raw reads later, both the study and samples must already exist on the ENA server.

[!IMPORTANT]
To perform a test submission, set the
(this is also the default). This will submit the data to the ENA

server
(this data will be removed automatically after 24h). To submit the data to the production server, set the parameter to

[!NOTE]
Before submitting the experiment, you must first transfer your files to the ENA FTP server.
Ensure again that your environment variables ENA_USERNAME and ENA_PASSWORD are properly set.
Execute the following QIIME 2 action to transfer the FASTQ files to the ENA FTP server.

qiime ena-uploader transfer-files-to-ena \
  --i-demux <your reads artifact> \
  --p-action ADD \
  --o-metadata transfer_metadata.qza
: The demultiplexed sequencing data, either single-end or paired-end.
: Specifies the action to take. The default is ADD, but you can use DELETE to remove files from the ENA FTP server.
: This is the output artifact containing information about the transfer or deletion status of files on the ENA FTP server.

[!IMPORTANT]
Make sure that your credentials are configured through the environment variables
Execute the following QIIME 2 action to submit experiment/run metadata to ENA:

qiime ena-uploader submit-metadata-reads \
  --i-demux <your reads artifact> \
  --i-experiment experiment_metadata.qza \
  --i-samples-submission-receipt samples_receipt.qza \
  --i-file-transfer-metadata transfer_metadata.qza \
  --p-submission-hold-date <hold date> \
  --p-action ADD \
  --p-dev \
  --o-submission-receipt receipt.qza
: The demultiplexed sequencing data, either single-end or paired-end.
: Artifact containing the submission receipt of the study and samples.
: Artifact containing the metadata of the file transfer to the ENA FTP server.
: 2 action types are supported: ADD (default) and MODIFY.
: A boolean parameter indicating whether the submission is a test.
: The release date for the data submission, determining when it will become public. The accepted date format is YYYY-MM-DD.
: The output artifact containing the assigned ENA accession numbers for the submitted objects.

[!IMPORTANT]
To perform a test submission, set the
(this is also the default). This will submit the data to the ENA

server
(this data will be removed automatically after 24h). To submit the data to the production server, set the parameter to
To submit all the metadata and raw reads in a single step, use the

action. This action will perform all
the steps which are required for the submission in the correct order. To see details about the individual steps and
required inputs please have a look at respective sections above.
To submit using the simplified procedure, execute the following command:

qiime ena-uploader submit-all \
  --i-study study_metadata.qza \
  --i-samples sample_metadata.qza \
  --i-experiment experiment_metadata.qza \
  --i-demux <your reads artifact> \
  --p-submission-hold-date <hold date> \
  --p-dev \
  --p-action ADD \
  --o-sample-submission-receipt samples_receipt.qza \
  --o-read-submission-receipt reads_receipt.qza \
  --o-file-upload-metadata upload_metadata.qza

name: q2-ena-uploader
description: QIIME 2 plugin for submission of metadata and raw sequence reads to ENA.
